description: From Russian бе́рковец (bérkovec); derived from бе́рковеск (bérkovesk), Old East Slavic бьрковьскъ (bĭrkovĭskŭ, “of Birka”), ultimately Old Norse Birka, a port city in mediaeval Sweden.

entries.meaning: (historical) An old Russian unit of weight, approximately 164 kilograms or 10 poods.
